Кибербуллинг - форма угрозы, в противовес которой создается модель комплексной 
безопасности личности 
(Cyberbullying is a form of threat, in contrast to which a model of comprehensive personal 
security is created) 
Рижик Виктория Александровна 
Студент 
РГУ нефти и газа (НИУ) имени И.М. Губкина 
 
АННОТАЦИЯ 
Построение модели комплексной безопасности личности позволило получить 
основу для просвещения студентов и формирования у них четкого представления о 
безопасности в сети.  Сама модель включает такие аспекты, как перечень мер по борьбе, 
основные способы защиты личности в сети на основе уже причиненного вреда здоровью 
(одно из крайних, суицид). Мысль, которая лежит в основе, «осведомленность - это и есть 
наше оружие», поэтому данная статья является не только теоретическим обоснованием 
проблемы, но и практическим побудителем к действию.  
 
ABSTRACT 
Building a model of complex personal security allowed us to get a basis for educating 
students and forming a clear understanding of online security. The model itself includes aspects 
such as a list of measures to combat, the main ways to protect an individual on the network 
based on the harm already caused to health (one of the extreme, suicide). The idea that underlies 
it is "awareness is our weapon", so this article is not only a theoretical justification of the 
problem, but also a practical incentive to action. 
 
КЛЮЧЕВЫЕ СЛОВА 
Кибербуллинг, травля, угроза, агрессор, жертва.  
 
KEYWORDS 
Cyberbullying, bullying, threat, aggressor, victim. 
 
Появление интернета стало отправной точкой для создания социальных сетей, 
площадок для свободного общения людей с разных уголков мира и мест выражения 
собственного мнения, которое не всегда имело положительный эффект в виде совета, 
помощи и поддержки, поэтому естественным образом зародилось течение, где ее 
представители выбрали сторону запугивания, травли и унижения. Данный феномен, 
задающий высокий градус агрессии, получил название кибербуллинг. 
Актуальность работы проявляется в том, что почти каждый студент (школьник) 
проводит весомую часть жизни в телефоне, социальных сетях, где и происходит 
формирование его взглядов и становление как личности, поэтому важно предпринять 
попытки в сторону защиты от угроз и буллинга. 
На основе методов сбора и анализа информационных ресурсов можно 
предложить систему с его ключевыми аспектами (причины, меры по борьбе, способы 
защиты), которая позволит реализовать на практике проведение мероприятия по 
просвещению студентов университета и транслирования: «насилие – это плохо». 
Дальнейшая разработка темы может проявляться в углублении теоретических 
знаний 
и 
масштабирования 
проводимых 
мероприятий 
среди 
представителей 
нефтегазовой отрасли и не только. Показать, что защищать необходимо не только саму 
информационную сеть, но и самого себя. Когда боремся с кибербуллингом, не ставим 
цель избавится от этого явления вовсе, так как это невозможно в современных реалиях. 

615

Перспективы развития высшего образования в России  
(Prospects of development of higher education in Russia) 
Саввина Софья Михайловна 
Бакалавр  
РГУ нефти и газа (НИУ) имени И.М. Губкина 
Научный руководитель: д. и. н., профессор Калинов В. В. 
 
АННОТАЦИЯ  
Проанализирована новая структура системы образования на основе изученной 
комбинированной 
модели 
цифровизации 
образовательного 
процесса. 
В 
ней 
подтверждается значение очной формы обучения и необходимость его превалирования 
в процессе образования. При этом, предполагается внедрение инновационных 
технологий в процесс обучения, использование интерактивных методик во время 
занятий, учитывающие особенности восприятия и обработки информации поколением 
Z. Новая методика позволит соответствовать современным реалиям, выработать 
осознанный подход у студента к учебе, повысить его заинтересованность и развить 
пытливость в поиске научной информации.  
 
ABSTRACT 
The new structure of the education system is analyzed on the basis of the studied 
combined model of digitalization of the educational process. It confirms the importance of full-
time education and the need for its prevalence in the educational process. At the same time, it 
is supposed to introduce innovative technologies into the learning process, the use of interactive 
techniques during classes, taking into account the peculiarities of perception and processing of 
information by generation Z. The new methodology will allow us to meet modern realities, 
develop a conscious approach for students to study, increase their interest and develop 
inquisitiveness in the search for scientific information. 
 
КЛЮЧЕВЫЕ СЛОВА  
Обучение, смешанная модель образования, преподаватель, студент, очное 
образование, цифровизация, непрерывность образования.  
 
KEYWORDS 
Training, blending model of education, teacher, student, full-time education, 
digitalization, continuity of education. 
 
Сегодня все чаще разгораются споры относительно цифровой трансформации 
образования. Одни отмечают существенное торможение и ухудшение из-за онлайн 
обучения, 
другие 
активно 
поддерживают 
использование 
инновационных 
и 
интерактивных технологий в образовании. Что же выбрать? Я предлагаю использование 
смешанной системы обучения, суть которой состоит в совмещении очного образования 
и технологического прогресса, позволяющего ярко и наглядно преподносить материал, 
который можно просмотреть несколько раз.  
Актуальность данной темы обусловлена ускорением технологического прорыва 
и все большим проникновением технологий в нашу жизнь. Вместе с этим, меняется и 
образовательный процесс, открывая новые возможности обучения и восприятия 
информации. 
В работе использовались методы поиска и отбора информации, синтез, 
обобщение, 
проведение 
социального 
опроса, 
анализ 
полученных 
данных, 
моделирование. 

617 
 
Дальнейшие исследования по данной теме помогут смоделировать целую систему 
непрерывного образования, которая сможет обеспечить формирование системного 
мышления, креативных способностей и заинтересованности в постоянном обновлении 
собственных знаний, сформировать осознанный подход к учебе.

2. Беляева Е. А., Грунт Е. В., Социологическая рефлексия дистанционных форм 
обучения в высшей школе в условиях Covid-19: проблемы перспективы дальнейшего 
развития, 2020, 263 с.  
 
REFERENCES: 
1. Bodrova E. V., Kalinov V. V., Scientific and technical potential of Russia: the search for 
ways to implement a technological breakthrough at the beginning of the XXI century, 2021,

osushchestvleniya tekhnologicheskogo ryvka v nachale XXI veka, 2021, 407 s.

obucheniya v vysshej shkole v usloviyah Covid-19: problemy perspektivy dal'nejshego 
razvitiya, 2020, 263 s. 
 
 

618 
 
Сотрудничество с Турцией – ключ к стабильности на энергетическом рынке 
(Cooperation with Turkey is the key to stability in the energy market) 
Семенова Ольга Михайловна1, Харитонов Дмитрий Николаевич2 
1,2Студент 
РГУ нефти и газа (НИУ) имени И.М. Губкина 
Научный руководитель: к.и.н., доцент Каримов О.В. 
 
АННОТАЦИЯ 
В данной работе рассмотрена история развития российско-турецких отношений, 
выдвинуто предположение, что сотрудничество с Турцией может способствовать 
укреплению России на энергетическом рынке. 
 
ABSTRACT  
This article examines the history of the development of Russian-Turkish relationships, 
suggests how cooperation with Turkey can contribute to the strengthening of Russia in the 
energy market. 
 
КЛЮЧЕВЫЕ СЛОВА 
Турция, Россия, сотрудничество, энергетический рынок. 
 
KEYWORDS 
Turkey, Russia, cooperation, energy market. 
 
Турция – важный экономический партнер России. Это одна из немногих стран, 
членов блока НАТО, которая может позволить себе оставаться нейтральной в отношении 
России. Успешное сотрудничество с Турцией позволит, по нашему мнению, 
стабилизировать отечественный и мировой энергетический рынок путем создания 
газового хаба. Это будет способствовать укреплению экономической безопасности 
России. Взяв за основу историю России и Турции, хотелось бы представить наиболее 
успешный вариант развития отношений между странами. 
Российско-турецкие отношения насчитывают более пяти веков. За это время 
между нашей страной и Турцией произошло немало войн, основной причиной которых 
были территориальные споры и борьба за влияние в регионах Малой Азии и Восточной 
Европы. В начале 20-х годов XX века взаимоотношения развивались в мирном ключе, 
налаживались дипломатические и торговые связи. Однако в 50-х годах из-за влияния 
США отношения между странами вновь обострились – в 1952 году Турция 
присоединилась к Североатлантическому альянсу. Несмотря на это, экономические 
отношения между Турцией и СССР продолжали развиваться. 
С 1991 года Турция перестала быть агрессивным юго-восточным рубежом НАТО. 
Кроме того, разногласия с Европейским Союзом не позволяют стать ей полноценным 
союзником Североатлантического альянса. В условиях нарастающей конфронтации 
между Россией и странами НАТО, мы считаем, что чем меньше стран вовлечено в 
конфликт, тем меньшие масштабы он принимает. Другими словами, появление большего 
количества нейтральных государств смягчит противостояние. Так, даже если Турция не 
станет полностью дружественной по отношению к России, она сможет оставаться 
нейтральной стороной. Это станет возможно при взаимовыгодном сотрудничестве 
между странами. Политика «кто нам не враг, тот друг» может принести гораздо больше 
плодов, чем политика «кто нам не друг, тот враг». 
Важно отметить, для того чтобы Турция не подвергалась давлению со стороны, 
т.е. оставалась нейтральной, ей необходима некая опора, позволяющая сохранять 

619 
 
независимость. С нашей точки зрения, именно сотрудничество с Россией в 
энергетическом секторе позволит Турции укрепить свои позиции. Кроме того, это будет 
выгодно и для России. Создание на территории Турции газового и нефтяного хаба стало 
бы ключом к сотрудничеству между странами. Не стоит забывать о сотрудничестве в 
атомной энергетике –  российские специалисты уже занимаются строительством 
атомной электростанции на территории Турции. Вероятно, на строительстве одной АЭС 
сотрудничество не закончится, однако это не является темой нашего исследования. 
Тем не менее нельзя не задуматься о рисках, которые могут возникнуть, если 
Россия будет опираться только на турецких партнеров. На взаимодействие стран 
оказывает влияние членство Турции в НАТО, противоречия по сирийскому вопросу, 
политика в отношении Армении, позиция о принадлежности Крыма, отношение к 
бывшим боевикам, проживающим на территории Турции и др.  
Подводя итоги, скажем, что выбор правильного направления развития российско-
турецких отношений на ближайшие 15-20 лет позволит странам добиться значительных 
успехов. Турция сможет укрепить суверенитет, что в свою очередь позволит оставаться 
нейтральной стороной, смягчающей конфронтацию между Россией и странами Запада. 
Россия же благодаря сотрудничеству в энергетическом секторе сможет улучшить свои 
позиции на мировой арене. 
 
ЛИТЕРАТУРА: 
1. Новичев А.Д. История Турции. Изд-во Ленинградского университета, 1963 
2. Гасанлы Д. СССР — Турция: полигон холодной войны. Баку, 2005.

620 
 
К проблеме ресоциализации личности в период кардинальных перемен 
(To the problem of resocialization of personality in the period of cardinal changes) 
Старшинова Надежда Андреевна 
Студент 
РГУ нефти и газа (НИУ) имени И.М. Губкина 
Научный руководитель: к.и.н., доцент Мусаева З.А. 
 
АННОТАЦИЯ 
В данной работе проводится исследование по ресоциализации человека и общества 
в период кардинальных изменений социальной структуры на примере Октябрьской 
революции. Предпринята попытка анализа факторов, влияющих на приспособляемость 
человека к новому образу жизни на примерах художественных и автобиографических 
произведений, а также представлена ресоциализация детей с девиантным поведением как 
отражение изменений в обществе. 
 
ABSTRACT 
In this issue the research on resocialization an individual and a society during the period of 
fundamental changes is conducted. The October Revolution was chosen as the example to show. 
An attempt was made to analyze the factors influence person’s adaptability to a new lifestyle. Some 
artistic autobiographical works are used in this issue. Also the resocialization of children with 
deviant behavior is presented as a reflection of changes in society. 
 
КЛЮЧЕВЫЕ СЛОВА 
Личность, общество, перемены, ресоциализация, адаптация. 
 
KEYWORDS 
Personality, society, changes, resocialization, adaptation. 
 
Постоянные перемены являются неизменным условием прогресса, эволюции 
человеческой цивилизации, причём, по мере развития человечества их становится всё 
больше. Эти перемены различаются и по интенсивности, и по скорости осуществления. 
Ресоциализация человека в период массовых изменений в обществе является 
актуальной проблемой и по сей день. Рассмотрение уже полученного опыта, в том числе и  в 
период глубокого потрясения во время революционных событий начала XX века может 
привести к определённым выводам, необходимым будущим поколениям  [7]. 
В данной работе сделана попытка рассмотреть эту достаточно сложную и 
малоизученную проблему – ресоциализацию общества в условиях кардинальных перемен, 
произошедших в результате Октябрьской революции 1917 г.   
Помимо научной литературы, нами были использованы также художественные 
произведения с автобиографическими нюансами, такие как: «Раздумья» Д.С. Лихачёва, 
«Кондуит и Швамбрания» Л. Кассиля, «Собачье сердце» М.А. Булгакова и «Республика 
Шкид» Л.Пантелеева. 
В нашей работе мы использовали метод анализа и сопоставление взглядов различных 
людей на ситуацию революционного состояния общества. Конечно, опираться на текст 
художественного произведения так же, как на исторические документы, нельзя. Но 
произведения, 
выбранные 
для 
анализа 
проблемы, 
обладают 
ценным 
качеством 
автобиографичности, поэтому, нам кажется возможным, частично их использовать. 
«В узком смысле ресоциализация предполагает усвоение индивидом ценностей и 
норм, радикально отличающихся от освоенных ранее» [5]. 
В нашей работе превалирует понятие ресоциализации именно этом смысле. Люди, 
жившие в Российской империи, не были готовы к жизни в условиях Советской власти. 
Однако, из-за революций процесс ресоциализации происходил для всех жителей страны 

621 
 
одновременно, что во многом его осложняло. Не было того, единого механизма, который 
был готов помогать людям меняться и принимать новые нормы.  
Все люди всех слоёв общества должны были приспосабливаться к постоянно 
двигающейся в неизвестном для них направлении реальности: Российская империя, Советы, 
Гражданская война, Советский Союз. Каждый приспосабливался со своей скоростью, кто-то 
быстро смог переориентироваться на новый курс, а кто-то не вынес перемен и был вынужден 
покинуть страну. Процесс ресоциализации зависит от множества факторов: возраст (как 
правило, чем старше человек, тем сложнее он переживают даже незначительные изменения), 
социальное происхождение, уровень образования, культуры, достатка, а также прежнее 
положение в обществе.  
Сформированное общество, несомненно, очень помогает индивиду приспособиться 
к новым условиям, поэтому в те периоды времени, когда социум сам кардинально меняется, 
людям становится сложно подстроиться под него, ведь подавляющему большинству 
необходимо полностью пересмотреть свои приоритеты, расставить их заново так, чтобы они 
стали нормой.  
Ресоциализация как процесс изменения личности легче всего проходит у детей, 
потому что они ещё не до конца сформировали свой внутренний мир с его требованиями и 
традициями. Однако, в моменты массовых перемен, дети становятся наиболее уязвимыми, 
как раз из-за того, что они ещё не готовы жить полностью самостоятельно, обеспечивать 
себя и разделять поступки на хорошие и плохие. Поэтому, на наш взгляд, важно в тяжёлые 
периоды уделять особое внимание пожилым людям и детям.

622 
 
Социальная ответственность как важнейшая составляющая ESG-трансформации 
российских ВИНК 
(Social responsibility as the most important component of the ESG transformation of Russian 
VIOC) 
Фоменкова Юлия Александровна 
Магистрант 
РГУ нефти и газа (НИУ) имени И.М. Губкина 
Научный руководитель: к.э.н. Москаленко А.А.  
 
АННОТАЦИЯ 
Автором изучается современное состояние ESG-повестки в России и мире.  
Рассматриваются тенденции развития социальной ответственности российских 
нефтегазовых компаний в условиях нестабильной экономической и политической среды. 
Анализируется социальная политика крупнейших ВИНК в рамках концепции 
устойчивого развития и ESG-трансформации бизнеса. Результаты исследования дают 
основания полагать, что S-компонента может стать главным драйвером формирования 
ESG-стратегии в России. 
 
ABSTRACT 
The author studies the current position of the ESG agenda in Russia and worldwide. The 
study considers the trends in the development of social responsibility of Russian oil and gas 
companies in an unstable economic and political environment. The social policy of the largest 
VIOC is analyzed within the framework of the concept of sustainable development and ESG 
business transformation. The results of the research give reason to believe that the S-component 
can become the driver of the ESG strategy’s formation in Russia. 
 
КЛЮЧЕВЫЕ СЛОВА 
ESG, устойчивое развитие, S-компонента, социальная ответственность, ВИНК, 
нефтегазовые компании. 
 
KEYWORDS 
ESG, sustainable development, S-component, social responsibility, VIOC, oil and gas 
companies. 
 
Принципы устойчивого развития и ESG-факторы (Environmental, Social, 
Governance) в последние годы были одной из самых обсуждаемых тем мирового 
сообщества. Однако современное состояние международных отношений вносит 
определенные коррективы. В период геополитической напряженности перед Россией 
встает вопрос об актуальности ESG-повестки, поскольку страна под жесткими 
санкциями, на нее наложено технологическое эмбарго, многие зарубежные компании 
приостановили работу на территории Российской Федерации. Помимо этого, в попытках 
снизить зависимость от отечественных углеводородов западные коллеги снова 
обращаются к «грязным» технологиям. Несмотря на стоящие перед Россией вызовы, 
государство продолжает регулировать вопросы, связанные с устойчивым развитием, 
более того, включает задачу по интеграции ESG-факторов в число национальных 
проектов. На данный момент формируется российская нормативная база ESG, которая 
будет адаптирована под стратегические цели и задачи для развития собственных 
технологий и в интересах общества.  
Тенденция последних лет показывает, что в рамках следования Целям 
устойчивого развития ООН (Организации Объединенных Наций), роль социальной 

623 
 
ответственности в деятельности российского нефтегазового бизнеса не уходит на второй 
план, напротив растет интерес к различным инициативам, которые связаны с 
экологическими, социальными и управленческими принципами (ESG). Социальные 
факторы все больше влияют на имидж и бренд компаний, на мнение инвесторов и 
заинтересованных сторон, а их место в ESG-стратегии отечественных компаний трудно 
переоценить. 
Представляется, 
что 
именно 
S-компонента 
станет 
драйвером 
ESG-
трансформации бизнеса в России, поскольку социальная ответственность была присуща 
отечественным компаниям задолго до формирования принципов ESG. Например, 
крупнейшие вертикально-интегрированные нефтяные компании всегда внимательно 
относились к своим работникам и местным жителям, проживающим в регионах их 
присутствия. В соответствии с корпоративной политикой нефтегазовых компаний – 
персонал является главным ресурсом организации, отражающим эффективность 
деятельности и обеспечивающим ее дальнейшее развитие. Многие эксперты отмечают, 
что в период возникших кадровых сложностей компании все больше осознают 
ответственность перед своими работниками и уделяют предельное внимание вопросам 
сохранения рабочих мест, мотивации и поддержки кадров.  Кроме того, социальные 
преобразования в рамках устойчивого развития и ESG-перехода отвечают запросам 
общества. В соответствии с данными опроса, проведенного ВЦИОМ (Всероссийского 
центра изучения общественного мнения) в 2022 году, в число наиболее значимых 
направлений, люди, проживающие в разных регионах России, включили следующие 
цели: обеспечение экологической устойчивости городов и населенных пунктов (62%), 
содействие экономическому росту и достойной работе для всех (61%), предоставление 
качественного уровня образования (45%).  
Таким образом, дальнейшее развитие социальной ответственности в контексте 
повестки устойчивого развития должно реализовываться как с позиции интересов 
правительственных органов и бизнес-сектора в период политической и экономической 
турбулентности, так и с точки зрения удовлетворения потребностей граждан.

Межкультурный диалог как фактор гармонизации межрелигиозных отношений 
(Intercultural dialogue as a factor of harmonization of interreligious relations) 
Шадыев Амриддин Таджиддинович 
Студент 
РГУ нефти и газа (НИУ) имени И.М. Губкина 
Научный руководитель: к.ф.н., доцент Семенова Т.Н. 
 
АННОТАЦИЯ 
Коммуникативные процессы являются основой цивилизационного развития. 
Особое место в этих процессах принадлежит межкультурному диалогу, в основе 
которого коммуникация между религиями, религиозными организациями и верующими. 
Христианско-исламский диалог позволяет выработать общие позиции в различных 
сферах жизни общества, прежде всего в сфере гуманитарного сотрудничества, 
сохранения 
общечеловеческих 
духовно-нравственных 
ценностей. 
Различия 
идеологических позиций христианства и ислама отодвигаются на задний план, если 
решается судьба человеческой цивилизации, мира, базовых ценностей.  
 
ABSTRACT 
Communicative processes are the basis of civilizational development. A special place 
in these processes belongs to intercultural dialogue, which is based on communication between 
religions, religious organizations and believers. The Christian-Islamic dialogue makes it 
possible to develop common positions in various spheres of society, primarily in the field of 
humanitarian cooperation, the preservation of universal spiritual and moral values. The 
differences in the ideological positions of Christianity and Islam are pushed into the background 
if the fate of human civilization, the world, and basic values is being decided. 
 
КЛЮЧЕВЫЕ СЛОВА 
Межкультурный диалог, межрелигиозный диалог, христианство, ислам, духовно-
нравственные ценности. 
 
KEYWORDS 
Intercultural dialogue, interreligious dialogue, Christianity, Islam, spiritual and moral 
values. 
 
Основой цивилизационного развития являются коммуникативные процессы, 
взаимодействие в экономической, политической, социальной и духовных сферах жизни 
общества.  
Расширение взаимосвязи и взаимозависимости в современном мире, бурный рост 
культурных обменов и прямых контактов между государственными институтами, 
социальными группами, общественными движениями и отдельными индивидами разных 
стран и культур ставит вопрос о наличии общих ценностей, идеалов как основы 
межкультурного диалога. 
Существуют области, наиболее благоприятные для установления диалога между 
христианством и исламом. Это социальное взаимодействие в различных сферах 
общества. Объединяют общие ценности – отрицательное отношение к спекулятивному 
капиталу (, к терроризму, к самоубийству, отрицательное отношение к преступности, 
развивается межрелигиозный диалог против экстремизма, наркотиков на платформе 
«Диалог Евразия», общие подходы в противодействии религиозной, этнической 
нетерпимости, по сохранению традиционных духовно-нравственных ценностей, 
семейных традиций, поддержания мира и согласия. 

625 
 
Построение христиано- мусульманского диалога – сложнейшая проблема, 
зависящая от политической воли в урегулировании межрелигиозных и межэтнических 
конфликтов (прежде всего в период беспрецедентно высокого уровня военной опасности 
в мире и угрозы ядерного апокалипсиса), развития культурного, межрелигиозного и 
гуманитарного сотрудничества.  
Поиски общих идеологических основ христиано-мусульманского диалога 
базируется на идее, что христианство и ислам – это авраамические религии, основанные 
на вере в единого Бога, пророков, в общие нравственные ценности (вера, честь, верность, 
милосердие). 
Области столкновения идеологических позиций — это прежде всего 
догматические различия представителей христианства и ислама (двуединая природа 
Иисуса Христа, догмат о Троице, отношение к Слову Божьему и др.). 
15 ноября 2022 года в Москве в Центре Императорского Православного 
Палестинского общества состоялась Международная конференция «Православие и 
ислам – межконфессиональный диалог в достижении глобального мира». Основной 
целью конференции стала консолидация усилий государственных, религиозных, 
общественных, образовательных и научных структур в развитии межконфессионального 
диалога. Данная конференция нацелена на сохранение духовных и нравственных опор 
человечества. Достижение мира посредством межконфессионального диалога в этом 
контексте очень важно, поскольку способствует укреплению партнерства и 
сотрудничества.

K-method data clustering a as tool for investigation of oil equipment failures and ensurance of 
their repair quality (on the example of cavitations and gas boilers) 
Abu-Hamdi Reda Validovich 1 
1Student of the Moscow Institute of Physics and Technology 
Scientific adviser: Ph.D., Associate Professor Shcherban P.S. 
 
ABSTRACT 
Modern statistical analysis methods of equipment failures require software that can both 
process large datasets and establish connections between these datasets. There is a number of 
mathematical methods that can be used to process equipment failures data, one of which is k-
means cluster analysis. In this research, both theoretical mathematical basis and its 
implementation in the form of custom software for processing statistical data of oil and gas 
equipment failures are presented. Using these methods, failures of gas boilers after initial repair, 
mechanical and electrical cavitation systems were successfully studied. 
 
KEYWORDS 
Oil and gas equipment, failures, mathematical analysis methods, Phyton programming, 
k-means cluster analysis, statistical data analysis. 
 
Introduction: standard oil and gas equipment failures analytics, employed in repair 
organizations, often does not allow establishing connections between factors that lead to 
equipment failures. To establish these connections mathematical methods like cluster analysis 
principal component analysis or finite element method can be used.  
The method used within this study is k-means cluster analysis and a custom software 
implementing the method developed for increased data processing speed. The custom software, 
written in Python programming language, includes not only data processing and visualization, 
but also calculation of the main cluster validation metrics, such as the Dunn index, silhouette, 
cluster separation, compactness and center. The results for cavitation equipment failures in 
storage tanks and for gas boiler failures after initial repair are presented in Figures 1 and 2 
respectively.  
 
Figure 1. Results of cluster analysis on failures of cavitations  - mechanical (a) and electrical 
(b) systems. 

628 
 
 
Figure 2. Results of cluster analysis on failures of gas boilers 
 
Application of cluster analysis revealed the interdependence of the considered factors 
on the transition of cavitation systems and gas boilers from the working state to the limit state 
and further to the non-working state. These transitions are essentially the 'empty zones' between 
clusters, characterized by their separation.  
Conclusion: As a result of K-means clustering analysis, it has been established that the 
deviation from the permissible values of the gasket tightening torque and its density in the 
mechanical part, as well as the current and temperature in the electrical part, have the greatest 
impact on the operability of the cavitation. This information allows paying special attention to 
these parameters of the cavitation design when performing corresponding technical 
maintenance and repair work. 
In the case of gas boilers, a different list of analyzed parameters was used (integral 
indicators such as failure severity or failure rate are compared instead of individual indicators). 
However, the principle remains the same. As a result, clusters with higher quality of repair work 
and equipment reliability (remote from the observer in the upper left corner) and clusters with 
low reliability and quality of repair work (closest to the observer) are identified. 
In general, this type of analysis allows improving the quality of repair and technical 
maintenance of oil and gas equipment at a service enterprise. The creation of a small software 
product, which was done in this study, significantly facilitates analytical work for the technical 
control department of the service enterprise and, in general, for engineers and managers 
working with equipment reliability. 
 
REFERENCES: 
1. Fangohr H., Kluyver T., DiPierro M. Jupyter in computational science //Computing in 
Science & Engineering. – 2021. – Т. 23. – №. 2. – С. 5-6. 
2. Peiyi W. et al. Analysis and research on enterprise resumption of work and production based 
on K-means clustering //2021 IEEE 6th international conference on big data analytics (ICBDA). 
– IEEE, 2021. – С. 169-174.

Software product for elaboration of water course pollution discharge standard 
Barskaya Sofia Maksimovna, Romanova Anna Yurievna 
Students 
Gubkin Russian State University of Oil and Gas 
(National Research University) 
Supervisor: Cand. Sc., Ass. Prof. Fomina Е.Е. 
 
ABSTRACT 
A new software product was compiled in order to estimate standards for permissible 
watercourse discharge based on the procedure elaborated by N.N. Lapshev. The programme 
obtained made it possible to provide reliable data on the accident that occurred at Norilsk Nickel 
Mining and Metallurgical Company in 2020 and to assess regional environmental damage [3]. 
 
KEYWORDS 
Pollution discharge standard (PDS), industrial watercourse, Lapshev estimation 
procedure, software product. 
 
Most production facilities are located in close proximity to water bodies, which 
considerably increases the probability of accidents capable to affect their ecosystems. From 2.5 
to 11 tons of oil are found to annually discharge into the world ocean, floating on its surface in 
the film form.  The film is gradually dissolved to form a stable emulsion; the remainder is partly 
settled on the bottom as heavy fraction. A specific example of similar situation is a major 
accident at MMC Norilsk Nickel that resulted in the release of 21,000 cubic meters of oil 
products into the Daldykan and Ambarnaya rivers, thus leading to critical pollution of the 
nearby ecosystem (Figure 1) [3]. Having studied this accident, we deemed it necessary to assess 
this vital damage and attempted to reliably determine a credible PDS exceedance figure. 
Assessment method elaborated by N.N. Lapshev has been chosen to estimate PDS for the 
enterprise watercourse. The resulting values are presented in Table 1 [4].  
 
 
Figure 1 Areas contaminated by oil products released during TPP-3 accident. 
 
 
 
 

630 
 
 
Table 1 Emissions into the Pyasina river near TPP-3 compared to MPC (mg/l) in terms of PDS. 
 
The estimation method used is based on calculating the watercourse dilution rate, that 
depends on plant discharge outlets geometry, river characteristics, flow rate and wastewater 
discharge rate [2]. The computer programs currently used to determine the watercourse 
pollutant discharge volume on the basis of PDS evaluation methods fail to fully consider the 
factors influencing the spread and further pollution of ecosystems. This lack of reliable 
programmes leads to distorted damage scale assessment [1].

Study of properties of reinforced gels synthesized with natural-derived additives 
Boldyreva Anastasia Alexandrovna1, Korolev Vitaly Konstantinovich1 
1Student 
1Gubkin Russian State University of Oil and Gas (National Research University) 
Scientific supervisor: Candidate of Chemistry Sciences, assistant professor Novikov A.A. 
 
ABSTRACT  
The main idea of this work was to produce gels with improved rheological and impact 
characteristics. We synthesized various gels prepared with added medical cotton wool, 
microfibrillar cellulose and nanocrystalline cellulose. These gels can be used for water shutoff 
in oil wells, for personal protective equipment, and as thickened electrolyte in acid batteries. 
 
KEYWORDS 
Reinforced gels, additive gels, polyethylene glycol, colloidal silicon dioxide, Rebinder-
Weiler technique. 
 
In the modern world, the search for new materials that improve product quality is 
relevant. In this work, we studied various methods for obtaining gels, as well as the synthesis 
of additive gels based on microfibrillar cellulose. For comparison, medical cotton wool was 
used. 
The main goal is to obtain gels with improved properties for their subsequent use, e.g.  
the application of gels for well waterproofing. As the strengths of the gels increase, their 
insulating properties will improve. However, most of the gel-forming water-insulating 
compositions known to date have a number of disadvantages, including: low penetrating ability, 
instability in reservoir conditions, toxicity, and high cost. Elimination of the listed shortcomings 
can significantly increase the competitiveness of this method of restricting the inflow of water 
into wells. In addition, with increasing resistance to shock loads, there is a prospect of using 
gels in personal protective equipment. 
In the course of the work, in addition to the synthesis of gels, a number of experiments 
were carried out, such as measuring viscosity, studying the impact properties of gels, studying 
the structure of gels using different percentages of colloidal silicon dioxide. All these 
experiments were carried out to study the behavior of gels under various conditions.

particle additives //Materials & Design. – 2016. – Т. 104. – С. 312-319.

thickening fluid //Rsc Advances. – 2015. – Т. 5. – №. 24. – С. 18367-18374. 
3. Singh M. et al. Effect of addition of different nano-clays on the fumed silica-polyethylene 
glycol based shear-thickening fluids //Materials Research Express. – 2018. – Т. 5. – №. 1. – С.

Case history of 3D scanning of products for reverse engineering purposes 
Brantov Semyon 
Master Student 
Gubkin Russian State University of Oil and Gas 
(National Research University) 
Academic adviser: Candidate of Technical Sciences, Assoc. Prof., Kulikova I. S. 
 
ABSTRACT 
The experience of applying three-dimensional scanning of a product by RangeVision 
Premium scanner with subsequent processing of the scan by means of standard software and 
creation of a CAD model of the scanned product is described. Difficulties are considered and 
prospects of application of three-dimensional scanning technology for reverse-engineering 
purposes are suggested. 
 
KEY WORDS 
Reverse engineering, 3D scanning, CAD, 3D modeling, design documentation, import 
substitution. 
 
Detailed and accurate design documentation is necessary to manufacture, repair and 
maintain oil and gas production equipment. In some cases, design documentation may be lost 
or not exist at all. Restoration of design documentation is not an easy task; it requires solving a 
great number of problems related not only to the shape of the surface of the part itself, but also 
to the choice of material, coating, setting the adequate manufacturing technology in order to 
obtain the required mechanical properties. 
Reverse engineering is a process of developing design documentation based on input 
data obtained from the initial product sample. It helps to solve these problems. Parts often have 
complex shapes that are difficult to measure using hand tools. One of the reverse engineering 
tools is scanning of an object and creation of solid model with the help of CAD.  
As part of this work, the parts were scanned with the RangeVision Premium scanner. 
The resulting mesh models were processed using ScanCenter NG software. Solid-state models 
in SolidWorks were built on the basis of the processed mesh models. In the process of the work 
peculiarities of scanning parts of different shapes and processing their scans were 
particularized. Experience in creating solid-state models based on scans in SolidWorks was 
obtained. 
Advantages and disadvantages of working with domestic equipment for three-
dimensional scanning were identified.  
The obtained results confirm the efficiency of three-dimensional scanning technology 
for parts of complex shape, and accelerate the process of design documentation release. 
 
REFERENCES:  
1. Mulenko V.V., Computer technologies and automated systems in mechanical engineering, 
Moscow: Gubkin University, 2015, 73 p.  
2. Seredovich V. A., Terrestrial laser scanning: monograph, Novosibirsk: Siberian State 
University of Geosystems and Technologies, 2009, 261 p.

Investigation of the Kaliningrad region oil genesis 
Vatagina Anna Vladislavovna 
Student 
Immanuel Kant Baltic Federal University 
Scientific director: PhD in Chemistry, associate professor Masyutin Ya.A. 
 
ABSTRACT 
Physical and geochemical analyses of oil samples from offshore and onshore fields of 
the Baltic petroleum province were carried out. Using gas chromatography-mass spectrometry 
(GC-MS) and isotopic composition of carbon, data on four deposits were obtained, and for the 
first time for two of them. Based on the results obtained, the conclusion about the origin and 
classification of the oils of the Kaliningrad region was made. This study may further contribute 
to the exploration of new deposits. 
 
KEYWORDS 
Crude oil deposits, offshore deposits, onshore deposits, GC-MS, isotopic composition 
of carbon, oil genesis, oil-and-gas zoning. 
 
The Baltic shield, the northwestern part of the Russian platform, has long attracted the 
attention of geologists. Geological studies have been conducted on the territory of the 
Kaliningrad Region since the middle of the XX century (Figure 1). 
 
 
Figure 1 Tectonic and geological oil-and-gas zoning of Kaliningrad region [1]: (I) oil fields; 
(II) boundaries of first-order structural units;(III) boundaries of second-order structural units. 
Oil fields: (1) Vostochno-Gorinskoye; (2) Novo-Iskrinskoye; (3) Novo-Serebryanskoye;(4) 
Sechenovskoye; (5) Ryazanskoye; (6) Gusev deposit (Ordovician); and (7) Druzhbinskoye. 
 
All the onshore deposits in the Kaliningrad region are classified as small ones, but the 
quality of oil produced from these fields is one of the highest in Russia. In particular, the 
development of the offshore Kravtsovskoye field (D6) is of crucial importance for the entire oil 
industry of the country since the recoverable reserves of the field are estimated at 9.1 million 
tons. Another offshore field, D33, is of even greater interest, and its recoverable reserves are 
estimated at 21.2 million tons. 
To understand the overall picture of the Baltic oil and gas province, a number of analyses 
were carried out to study the physical and geochemical parameters of oil, as well as the 
properties of samples of continental and offshore deposits were compared. 
One of the most important physical and chemical indicators is the fractional 
composition, which was established according to GOST 2177-99 (ISO 3405-88). In accordance 

634 
 
with the experimental data, it can be concluded that diesel and fuel oil fractions predominate in 
the oil samples of the Kaliningrad region, but the total share of light petroleum fractions is more 
than 50% by weight. 
Moreover, oil samples were examined for the isotopic composition of carbon (Table 1). 
 
Table 1 С isotope content in oil samples

Based on the analysis, offshore and onshore oil samples were formed from organic 
matter of continental origin. This conclusion is also confirmed by the pristane/phytane ratios 
obtained using GC-MS. The values of isoprenoid coefficient demonstrate significant 
predominance of n-alkanes over branched isoprenoids (figure 2). 
 
Figure 2 GC-MS results 
 
All the studied oils of the Baltic Shield can be attributed to type A1 according to the 
classification of Al. A. Petrov, oil-source formation of continental origin that makes them 
valuable for processing since they contain up to 60% wt. alkanes, and n-alkanes account for 25-
30% of the total alkanes. Such oils mainly contain weakly branched alkanes. 
The conducted research for the first time examines the origin of the D33 offshore and 
Ladushkinskoye onshore fields that is important in order to understand their genesis and 
possible routes of processing.

Achieving carbon neutrality in the Russian oil and gas industry: legal aspect 
Vlasova Valentina Yurievna 
Student 
Gubkin Russian State University of Oil and Gas (National Research University) 
 
ABSTRACT 
Nowadays the trend towards ESG-transformation and decarbonization, especially in the 
oil and gas industry, is actively spreading worldwide. This paper is devoted to the analysis of 
national legal regulation on the issue of reducing greenhouse gas emissions and the 
implementation of experimental quotas in this area. The long-term prospects for the legislative 
process development and the challenges facing the Russian oil and gas complex are also 
considered. 
 
KEYWORDS 
Decarbonization, carbon neutrality, ESG-transformation, greenhouse gas emissions, 
legal regulation, oil and gas. 
 
According to research data, about 75% of anthropogenic greenhouse gas emissions in 
the world are caused by the oil and gas sector. 
Despite the current geopolitical situation, the development of "green" and low-carbon 
energy remains one of the most relevant issues on the international agenda. The trend of ESG-
transformation and sustainability is global in nature and it is being actively implemented in the 
Asian-Pacific region markets, which are vital for Russian business cooperation today. 
In 2021, by Decree of the President of the Russian Federation N 400 of July 2, 2021, 
the National Security Strategy of the Russian Federation was adopted. Environmental safety 
and rational use of natural resources are known to be an integral component of national security. 
Therefore, one of the most important tasks outlined in the Strategy is the formation of a law 
regulation system and ensuring the implementation of projects targeted at reducing greenhouse 
gases and increasing their absorption. 
A certain role was also played by the international obligations of the Russian Federation, 
established by the Paris Climate Agreement of December 12, 2015 and other international acts. 
All this predetermined the rapid development of carbon legal regulation, which is aimed, among 
other things, at oil and gas companies. 
To begin with, it is worth noting that along with the Strategy, Federal Law No. 296 of 
July 2, 2021 "On Limiting Greenhouse Gas emissions" was immediately adopted. There are 
several directions of climate regulation that can be distinguished in this Law. Firstly, the 
concept of a regulated organization and its reporting obligation are introduced (Article 7). 
Secondly, there is a climate project concept and the possibility of its implementation by any 
organizations (Article 9). Thirdly, it provides the civil turnover with a new element - carbon 
units (Articles 2, 9, 10). Next, the Law declares the measures to support climate projects 
realization (Article 9). Finally, the Law imposes certain obligations on oil and gas companies, 
their infringement causes administrative liability in the form of fines. 
However, the Law on Greenhouse Gases establishes only general directions of climate 
regulation, that is why it is defined as a "framework" law. Indeed, a significant amount of laws 
is being developed additionally. For example, the criteria for classifying legal entities and 
individual entrepreneurs as regulated organizations are determined by the Decree of the 
Government of the Russian Federation No. 355 of March 14, 2022. 
Furthermore, in March 2022, Federal Law No. 34 "On conducting an experiment to limit 
greenhouse gas emissions in certain Russian constituent entities" was adopted. Thus, 

636 
 
experimental quotas for greenhouse gas emissions can be another essential area of the current 
legislative process. 
Companies in the oil and gas sector are already actively implementing low-carbon 
projects: Novatek runs business according to sustainable development strategy, Gazprom notes 
in its ESG report for 2021 that the company reduced methane emissions by 40 thousand tons in 
comparison with the previous year, Rosneft plans to prevent CO2 emissions in the amount of 
20 million tons by 2035 thanks to low-carbon solutions in future projects. 
To understand the long-term prospects of decarbonization, it is necessary to refer to the 
Decree of the President of the Russian Federation No. 666 of November 4, 2020 "On reducing 
greenhouse gas emissions", which instructed the Government of the Russian Federation to: 
a) ensure by 2030 a reduction in greenhouse emissions to 70% relative to the 1990 level; 
b) draft a Strategy for socio-economic development of the Russian Federation taking 
into account the specifics of economic sectors with a low level of greenhouse emissions until 
2050; 
c) ensure the creation of conditions for the implementation of measures to reduce and 
prevent greenhouse emissions, as well as to increase the absorption of such gases. 
In conclusion, Russia has a lot to strive for, but the first confident steps in the legal 
regulation of achieving carbon neutrality, especially in the oil and gas sector, have already been 
successfully taken. In this regard, it is necessary to continue monitoring draft acts in the field 
of climate regulation, organize their public discussion, conduct consultations with relevant 
bodies in the field of sustainable development. 
 
REFERENCES: 
1. Federal Law No. 296-FZ of 02.07.2021 "On limiting greenhouse gas emissions" // 
"Collection of Legislation of the Russian Federation", 05.07.2021, No. 27 (Part I), Article 5124. 
2. Decree of the President of the Russian Federation of 02.07.2021 N 400 "On the National 
Security Strategy of the Russian Federation" // "Collection of Legislation of the Russian 
Federation", 05.07.2021, N 27 (Part II), Article 5351.

the Moscow School of Management SKOLKOVO; March 2021. 158 p.

Implementation of digital gamification in the oil and gas university educational process 
Volkov Denis Andreevich1, Emelianova Arina Alekseevna2 
1Assoc. Prof., 2Master’s degree student 
Gubkin Russian State University of Oil and Gas (National Research University) 
 
ABSTRACT 
The work presents the introduction of digital gamification in the university educational 
process. The approach is based on algorithms and methods development of digital gamification 
based on the educational rating of students, including a standard interactive/game learning 
service, leaderboards, etc. The use of game mechanics and the introduction of a competitive 
component will help to increase the efficiency of mastering the material and raise motivation 
to learn. 
 
KEYWORDS 
Gamification, digital gamification, CIS, education, modular architecture. 
 
Nowadays gaming technologies strongly occupy a place in daily life. The gambling 
enthusiasm that arises during the game generates emotional involvement in a person, and the 
supposed rewards increase motivation and interest to study. However, currently most classical 
universities use only the simplest approaches to gamification, rooted in the Soviet past [1]. For 
example, socialist competitions, pennants, certificates and honor boards. 
Thus, the development of a gamification service based on rating control is an important 
task that allows increasing the student's interest in learning the material. 
The result of this work is a Web Application based on modular architecture. Modular 
architecture (figure 1) is defined as a set of elementary modules that perform a specific task or 
function. 
 
Figure 1 Architecture of the application 
 

638 
 
The designed application contains the following elements: 
1. Point’s converter is responsible for generating test data, such as groups of students, 
and simulating getting a rating. For Gubkin University, the educational score stored in the 
university information system can be used as the initial data. The normalized data, proceeded 
by points converter, is entered into the application database via the API core (Main app). 
2. Personal account module (student, administrator and teacher) that interact with the 
API core (Main app). 
3. Main app performs the functions of entering points, processing requests from users, 
as well as working with games. 
4. Game module — a program platform for the implementation of games, quizzes, etc. 
The JavaScript stack MERN (MongoDB, Express, React, Node.js) was chosen for 
implementation. Server part will be developed using Node.js and Express, which serves to 
configure routing and create an API server for interaction between the client and server parts 
of the application. To create a user interface, it is supposed to use the React framework.  
MongoDB acts as the main database, and since the system assumes a large connectivity of data 
that is convenient to visualize in the form of graphs, the Neo4j database will be used in addition 
to MongoDB. 
Such gamification platform can be vital for educational process, especially in oil and 
gas sphere, where many different specific technical disciplines is teaching. Some simulator 
software of these disciplines can be integrated into platform after modification to make study 
process more fascinating to students. As example of such software would be reliability 
calculation tool which is used in the reliability of oil and gas equipment course [2]. 
The practical significance is proved by the fact that every year the number of the 
gamification uses for educational purposes regular increases. This method is used from teaching 
schoolchildren and preschoolers to the introduction of game elements in the learning process 
of large companies, such as, for instance, Sberbank. It offers to use the BoxBattle platform 
within the frames of the "Sber University" [3]. Therefore, the development of such services is 
an acute task that finds application both in the business and in the educational sphere.

International environmental legal standards 
for oil and gas pipelines in International Waters 
Galdashkina Arina Vladimirovna 
Student 
Peoples’ Friendship University of Russia, 
National University of Oil and Gas «Gubkin University» 
(National Research University) 
Scientific supervisor: Dementyev Andrey Andreevich, Cand. of Jud. Sc. 
 
ABSTRACT 
According to the statistics, 80% of failures of the submarine pipelines occur during the 
pipeline operation. Thus, during the period when it is pumped, the failure may be accompanied 
by hydrocarbon leakage which negatively affects the environment. All defects that may lead to 
the development of such accidents should be detected, timely eliminated, or prevented. To do 
this, it is necessary to have a clear understanding of the existing triggers that could cause 
pipeline defects and damage and, based on this information, develop, and implement 
appropriate safeguards including the international legal standards. 
 
KEYWORDS 
International law, oil and gas, pipelines, International Waters, environment. 
 
The relevance of the study is supported by the fact that the legal affiliation of the pipeline 
is relevant in identifying entity responsible under international law for damage to the 
environment. 
The object of the study is the international legal relations that arise in connection with 
the construction and maintenance of submarine pipelines, the environmental impact of pipeline 
use. 
The methodological basis of the study consists of general scientific methods, including 
dialectical, logical, comparative-legal methods. 
The regulatory framework consists of:  
1. UN Convention on the Law of the Sea, 1982;  
2. Convention on Environmental Impact Assessment in a Transboundary Context, 
1991;  
3. International Convention for the Prevention of Pollution from Ships, 1973;  
4. International Convention on Liability and Compensation for Damage in Connection 
with the Carriage of Hazardous and Noxious Substances by Sea, 1996;  
5. Agreement on the Establishment of the World Trade Organization, 1994;  
6. Energy Charter Treaty, 1994. 
Vertically integrated oil and gas companies are involved in the transportation of oil, gas, 
and petroleum products through the submarine pipelines. If transport takes place between 
States, it becomes international. The laying of trunk pipelines in International Waters presents 
several difficulties, primarily legal ones. In determining the legal status of cross-border trunk 
pipelines, the approach to the classification of pipelines on the Unified Project model and the 
Interconnector model is used. The first approach describes a pipeline network that is governed 
by one legal regime, with one State acting as manager. This network is most favorable when 
there is a potential conflict of interest in the region where pipelines are laid. The Interconnector 
model is characterized by the fact that passing through different national legal regimes, the 
pipeline belongs to a different legal system, thus, the backbone network connects with different 
states. 

640 
 
In the international law relating to the energy sphere and to transboundary pipelines, the 
regulation of international relations on several key environmental aspects plays an important 
role. It is expressed in an environmental support for the development and implementation of a 
transboundary economic project or in an environmental protection in the operation of a 
transboundary facility. 
Factors affecting the condition of trunk pipelines are natural factors, which include the 
interaction with the seabed ground and the influence of the aquatic environment on the pipeline 
by changing the structure of the seabed; man-made factors include corrosion, destruction of 
metal and equipment, violation of operation modes. Early identification of the above factors is 
essential for the safe operation of oil and gas pipelines. Safety is about the environment first. 
The example of the Nord Stream Pipelines explosion shows that the determining of the 
applicable law is deemed crucial since the measures should be taken by the guilty parties. 
However, the uncertainty in the legal framework makes it complicated. 
The research identifies that the clarity of legal standards implemented to the contracts 
should be expanded in order to manage the environmental peculiarities. 
 
REFERENCES: 
1. Soubeyrol J. Cit. pp. 157–161; Cited from: Vylegzhagin A. International legal framework 
for subsoil use. M. 2007. pp. 208-211.  
2. Herbert S. International Law Regime of Transboundary Pipelines. Herbert Smith 
publications. 2002.  
3. Valdman N. A. Risk analysis and security for offshore operations and offshore operations / 
Valdman N. A., Jarkih N. V., Maleryanko N. L., Yakovlev D. M. – SPb.: FGUP «Krylovsky 
State Scientific Center», 2018 – p. 258.

Prospects for the introduction of a test site for the development of oil and gas fields of the 
Arctic shelf 
Kadyrova Satya Dzhalolovna1, Tyumerova Christina Gennadevna2 
1,2Master’s Degree student 
1,2Gubkin Russian State University of Oil and Gas 
Academic advisor: d.t.s., professor Andreeva N. N. 
 
ABSTRACT 
The aim of the project is to work out the concept of creating a testing ground for 
determining the effectiveness of technologies and testing equipment of Russian manufacturers, 
as well as the development of technical and technological systems used in the Arctic. The 
project is aimed at developing the market of innovative products, that effectively solve 
problems of both energy and economic security, simultaneously covering the problems of 
technological independence of the Russian Federation. 
 
KEYWORDS 
Testing ground, Arctic testing sites, test equipment, determining the efficiency of 
technologies, road map. 
 
The Arctic is one of the key areas of development of the oil and gas industry at the state 
level. One of Russia's strategic objectives, from the point of view of ensuring national energy 
security and strengthening its presence in the region, is the development of oil and gas resources 
of the Arctic shelf. With the depletion of reserves of deposits in Western Siberia, the question 
arises of the development of new deposits, mainly located in the Arctic region and the 
continental shelf. 
The complex geological structure of Arctic deposits requires the integration of modern 
technologies, the latest equipment and competent engineering solutions for the effective 
development of oil and gas reserves. This, in turn, dictates the need to create test sites where 
manufacturers could test equipment in Arctic climatic conditions. 
The sphere of organizations of test sites has been actively developing abroad for a long 
time, as examples are the companies "OHMSETT", "ProLabNL B.V." and "Ullrigg Drilling 
and Well Centre", whose services were also used by Russian companies. 
Currently, the development of testing centers and testing grounds in Russia is becoming 
an increasingly urgent task. First of all, this is due to the introduction of the development of 
deposits with hard-to-recover reserves, including on the Arctic shelf. Secondly, with the 
introduction of Western sanctions and the prohibition of supplies of oil and gas technologies 
and equipment to Russia, which is the reason for the search by oil and gas and oilfield service 
companies for new ways of their import substitution. 
The Arctic test site will become the foundation for the development of competitive 
technical and technological systems for the exploration and production of oil and gas in Arctic 
conditions, capable of ensuring the technological independence of the country. 
The creation of an Arctic testing ground is capable of solving many different tasks at 
the state level, namely: 
1) substitution of imported products; 
2) creation and improvement of quality indicators of equipment and technologies 
supplied to the oil and gas market used in the Arctic zone; 
3) development of industrial sectors, etc. 
There are no clauses in Russian legislation regulating the activities of test sites. The 
analysis of the legal framework revealed changes that have a positive impact on the 
development of test sites. Thus, the federal law "On Subsoil" introduced paragraph 3.1 of 

642 
 
02.12.2019 N 396-FZ: "The subsoil is provided for use for: 3.1) the development of 
technologies for geological exploration, exploration and extraction of hard-to-recover 
minerals." 
This amendment makes it possible for subsurface users, i.e. oil producing companies, 
to create test sites, and does not solve the problems of creating a landfill by oilfield service 
companies whose goals are the development and supply of equipment for the oil and gas 
industry. 
The idea of creating test sites was continued in the State Program of the Russian 
Federation "Socio-economic development of the Arctic Zone of the Russian Federation" (as 
amended on March 31, 2020). In the end, the program was closed and did not receive proper 
development. 
The methods of implementation of this project are based on the analysis of the legal 
framework of the Russian Federation and the identification of gaps in regulatory documents, 
the elimination of which will solve the problems of the functioning of test sites in Russia. 
The analysis carried out within the framework of this project made it possible to identify 
problems hindering the activities of test sites, develop a systematic approach to regulating their 
work and determine the necessary level of state support for their development. 
The practical significance of the project lies in the development of a roadmap containing 
the key stages of the creation of the Arctic Test Site, taking into account the timing of their 
implementation.

An instrument for improving the efficiency of the development of boundary oil rims 
Parkhomenko Dmitriy Valerievich 
Master`s student 
State university of Tyumen 
Scientific research supervisor: cand sc. (technology), Apasov R.T. 
 
ABSTRACT 
The influence of the time of pulling the gas cone to the producing well in the boundary 
oil rim has been studied. A special parameter was introduced that combines piezo conductivity 
and geometric characteristics of the oil rim, on the basis of which a number of tools were 
formed. Thus, based on the minimum number of parameters, it is possible to determine the most 
optimal development mode. 
 
KEYWORDS 
Sub-gas zones, enhanced oil recovery, cost-effectiveness assessment, boundary oil rims. 
 
Oil rims account for 13% of the hard-to-recover reserves in the Russian Federation, and 
less than 2% of the total reserves of gas and oil deposits have been extracted. Taking into 
account the small capacity of the oil part of the deposit (2-15 m), increasing the oil recovery 
coefficient (OR) is difficult and averages about 15%, when the optimal average OR for field 
development is 30% [1]. 
At the stage of exploration drilling, when designing a field, there are many geological 
and physical uncertainties that reduce the accuracy of development. It is urgent to develop 
primary assessment tools that will reduce risks and increase the efficiency of the development 
of marginal oil wells with a minimum amount of geological and physical data. 
In order to develop the tool, multifactorial scenarios were calculated in the form of 
synthetic sector hydrodynamic models, in which such parameters as: M-factor (ratio of the pore 
volume of the gas cap to the pore volume of the oil rim), permeability, angle of inclination and 
thickness of the oil rim were calculated [1, 2]. The following parameters were considered as 
output parameters: accumulated discounted oil and gas production, net present value. The 
results of hydrodynamic models on the depletion drive and with reverse gas injection (20%, 
40%, 100% of the accumulated gas volume, respectively) were studied. 
During the study of the obtained results, the dependence was determined between the 
distribution of pressure in the system, the change in compressibility due to the variation of the 
M-factor parameter, the distance between the gas-oil contact (GOC) and the producing well 
(which includes the thickness and angle of inclination of the oil rim), which were combined 
when calculating the U-factor. The following is the derived formula (1) for calculating the time 
of pulling the gas cone from the gas cap to the producing well:  
𝑈= √1
𝜒∙𝑊 
(1) 
where U – the time of pressure redistribution depending on the distance between the 
GOC and the producing well (sec0,5); 
χ – piezo conductivity, (m2/sec); 
W – the distance between the GOC and the producing well, m. 
Based on the above formula, a pallet was formed in figure 1, on the basis of which the 
NPV change is traced under the influence of a certain permeability and angle of inclination of 
the oil rim. If the object under study is located above the approach boundary of the gas cone at 
certain geological and physical parameters, then the depletion drive will be effective 
accordingly. With an increase in W (the distance from the GOC to the well), the gas cone takes 

644 
 
longer to reach the bottom of the well, respectively displacing more oil. In addition, the 
accumulated oil production depends on the piezo conductivity and initial gas reserves in the gas 
cap, which characterizes the additional reservoir energy and the rate of approach of the gas cone 
due to pressure redistribution. 
 
Figure 1 An example of a pallet for depletion drive with a small gas cap and a 40 m thick oil 
rim. 
Thus, the U-factor introduced during the study makes it possible to determine the 
optimal geological and physical conditions under which it is possible to determine the most 
effective way to develop an oil rim. The parameter is implemented in a methodology with a 
number of tools [1], which allows for an initial assessment of the effectiveness of the 
profitability of the object at an early stage of the development of the conceptual project of the 
field, to reduce risks in cases where it is impossible to use more complex tools.

The role of commercial arbitration in modern foreign economic relations  
Petukhova Anastasia Andreevna1, Norkina Polina Sergeevna2 
1,2Student 
1,2Gubkin Russian State University of Oil and Gas 
 
ABSTRACT 
In the modern world, international trade is developing widely, attracting foreign 
investment in business is growing and the import and export of oil and gas are increasing 
rapidly. In the implementation of foreign economic relations, it is impossible to exclude the 
possibility of disagreements and breaches of contracts. All this determines the relevance and 
importance of such an institution as international commercial arbitration. It contributes to the 
creation of beneficial conditions for the effective settlement of international economic disputes. 
This is undoubtedly relevant in the current difficult international situation. 
 
KEYWORDS  
Alternative forms of civil rights protection, international commercial arbitration, 
arbitration court, ICAC, The Arbitration Centre at the ANO NIRA TEC. 
 
International commercial arbitration is an independent non-governmental judicial body 
meant to consider and resolve civil law disputes arising in the course of economic activity 
complicated by the participation of foreign entities. Disputes are considered by independent 
arbitrators in accordance with procedures chosen by the parties. The autonomy of the will of 
the parties in choosing the procedure of a particular proceeding, as well as in choosing the law 
applicable to the proceedings of the case, is limited by the mandatory norms of national 
legislation and arbitration rules. Governmental interference in the operation of arbitration is 
minimized. The impact of the first is limited only by legal regulation. 
One of the independent permanent arbitration institutions is the International 
Commercial Arbitration Court (ICAC), located in Moscow, Russia. The ICAC administers 
international commercial arbitrations, but may also administer arbitrations of internal, corporate 
and sports disputes. Over the past time, the ICAC has accumulated serious experience and today 
is rightfully considered one of the largest arbitration centers in the world, considering both 
international and domestic commercial disputes. 
Arbitration proceedings in the ICAC is one of the alternative forms of civil rights 
protection, since this court is not included in the legal system of the Russian Federation, which 
is established by Article 118 of the Constitution of the Russian Federation and the Federal Law 
«On the Judicial System of the Russian Federation». Due to this, the ICAC does not belong to 
the bodies that administer justice, but this provision does not call into question about the legality 
of the existence of such an arbitration institution. 
According to the annual report of the London Court of International Arbitration (LCIA), 
the percentage of cases in the energy and resources sector reached 25% of cases in 2021. No 
doubt, this statistics is justified because oil and gas sphere impact on the economy not only one 
country, but also the whole world.  Many large oil and gas companies have created their own 
arbitration courts (Gasprom, Lukoil). However, all of them have now discontinued. 
On September 1, 2021 the Arbitration Centre at the Autonomous non - commercial 
organization «National Institute for the Development of Arbitration in the Fuel and Energy 
Complex» was founded which in its operations relies on the extensive positive practice of the 
Gazprom Arbitration Court for the resolution of civil disputes. The institute was established in 
order to fulfill public needs aimed at facilitating dispute resolution and settlement of legal 
conflicts in the energy sector and other sectors of the economy. 

646 
 
In conclusion, it should be said that there are some alternative forms of civil rights 
protection, for example ICAC and the Arbitration Centre at the ANO NIRA TEC which are 
intended to protect commercial interests of the oil and gas companies around the world through 
an effective, fair and neutral legal mechanism.  
 
REFERENCES: 
1. The Law of the Russian Federation «On International Commercial Arbitration» dated 
07.07.1993 N 5338-1//Rossiyskaya Gazeta, No. 156, 14.08.1993 
2. Kostin A.A. MKAS 90 years – normal flight // Commercial Arbitration No. 1(8), 2022 – 
pp.15-18 
3. Dobrogorskaya V.O. «International Commercial Arbitration at the present stage» Issues of 
Russian Justice, No. 4, 2019, pp. 479-484.

Stakeholder management of oil and gas projects in Iraq: challenges and peculiarities 
Semyanova Nadezhda Alexandrovna 
Student 
National University of Oil and Gas «Gubkin University» 
Scientific supervisor: Candidate of Economic Sciences, Bachinina Yulia Petrovna 
 
ABSTRACT 
The study examines the challenges of oil and gas company’s stakeholder management 
practices in the process of execution of major project in Iraq. The distinctive traits of 
stakeholders in regional markets and the peculiarities of their management were identified. 
Identification of stakeholder management regional characteristics would benefit the quality of 
major projects’ implementation and reduce the risks associated with ineffective project 
execution. 
 
KEYWORDS 
Stakeholder management, project management, foreign projects, Middle East. 
 
The paper examines the challenges of stakeholder management faced by an oil and gas 
company in the process of project implementation in Iraq. The topic relevance could be 
attributed to the importance of major oil and gas projects in the context of growing cooperation 
between Russia and Middle Eastern countries.  
The major projects in the Middle East have a strategic significance for Russian oil and 
gas companies in conditions of fluctuation geopolitical environment and severe economic 
instability. In the light of political discrepancies between Russia and the West, the formation of 
enduring connections between Russia and the Middle Eastern countries becomes one of the 
central topics on today’s agenda. The importance of strategic partnership with the Middle East 
is recognized both by the government and private business. According to expert opinions and 
government evaluations, the volume of cooperation initiatives with the Middle Eastern partners 
is expected to grow in the following years. Iraq has proven to be an important regional partner 
for Russia with several major projects being implemented and billions of dollars invested in 
Iraqi oil and gas sector over the last years. It could be stated that expanding Russian presence 
in Iraqi energy market and cooperation with local companies in terms of project execution 
would yield significant economic benefits. Thereby the question of building stable relationships 
with regional government and businesses becomes increasingly significant in the context of 
project management. 
Stakeholder management’s main steps include the identification of stakeholders, 
analyzing their needs and expectations, measuring the level of their influence on the project and 
outlining the effective strategy of mutual communications. It has been proven in academic 
literature that insufficient efforts in terms of stakeholder management often account for 
significant economic losses and project failures. Thus, identifying main stakeholders and their 
needs is argued to be one of the main steps in the process of project planning. 
The study examines the distinctive traits of external stakeholders (i.e., operating outside 
of the company or business) of major oil and gas project in Iraq. The direct stakeholders include 
other oil and gas companies, regional and local governments, local communities, and investors. 
Indirect stakeholders include mass and social media and non-governmental organizations 
(NGOs). 
The study identifies the following peculiarities and challenges of stakeholder 
management of projects in Iraq: 

648 
 
− the presence of protectionist policies and local laws, requiring a major part of the 
project’s personnel to be hired among local citizens despite their insufficient qualifications for 
the project implementation; 
− the importance of constant evaluation of local and regional military conflicts; 
− local communities’ low standards of living and well-being; 
− instability of political regime and the risks of local power shifts; 
− the need to ensure a high level of security for project personnel; 
− insufficient level of social and industrial infrastructure required to execute a project. 
Taking the abovementioned challenges into the account in the process of project 
planning in Iraq would facilitate managers’ efforts to build an efficient strategy of stakeholder 
management in the region.

Ranging of reducing greenhouse gas emissions approaches for solving Decarbonization 
problems of oil and gas projects 
Smetanina Liubov Alexeevna 
Master's student1, Engineer2 
National Research Tomsk Polytechnic University, Tomsk, Russia1 
Joint Stock Company "Tomsk Petroleum Institute", Tomsk, Russia2 
Research advisor: Ph.D. in Engineering Science, Kolmogorova V.A2. 
 
ABSTRACT 
An analysis of the applicability of existing methods for reducing greenhouse gas 
emissions at oil and gas industry facilities was carried out. A feasibility study of the proposed 
technologies has been completed. The potential reduction in greenhouse gas emissions has been 
calculated. Recommendations were given for a potential CAPEX reduction. 
 
KEYWORDS 
Decarbonization, greenhouse gases, RES, capital investments. 
 
After entry into legal force of Federal Act of the Russian Federation No. 296-FZ [1], 
projects aimed at decarbonization of production have acquired particular relevance in the 
activities of oil and gas companies. 
According to global practice [2], the most developed way to reduce greenhouse gas 
emissions is the capture of carbon dioxide after combustion with its further injection into the 
reservoir (CCS). 
In case of 95% of APG utilization, the main contribution to greenhouse gas emission at 
the fields is typically caused by generation of electricity [3] based on gas-turbine power plants. 
According to the literature data [4], the cost of CO2 capturing from the flue gases of a 
gas-turbine power plants ranges from 80 to 160 USD/tCO2. In the absence of a revenue in CCS 
projects, CAPEX reduction in that kind of projects becomes the task of particular relevance. 
Costs optimization for decarbonization is possible for contemplated power plants by 
involving in the consideration of alternative methods of energy generation: the use of renewable 
energy sources, replacing the scheme of power plants using open-cycle gas turbines with a 
scheme with the organization of a steam-gas cycle, as well as integration of these approaches 
into the "classical" capture technology.  
An assessment of CAPEX and potential carbon emission reduction for each possible 
combination of approaches for contemplated 100 MW gas turbine power plant was made. 
The grading of technologies according to the reducing greenhouse gas emissions is 
shown on Figure 1. 

650 
 
 
Figure 1 Ranging of emission reduction technologies 
 
The results of the feasibility study showed that sufficient reduction of CAPEX due to 
the involvement in the consideration of alternative methods of energy generation is possible 
throughout the entire range of carbon emission reduction potential. 
Depending on the required share of emission reduction, cost optimization can range 
from 24 to 122 billion rubles for a contemplated 100 MW power plant. 
 
REFERENCES: 
1. Federal Act of the Russian Federation № 296-FZ dated 01.06.2021 On limiting greenhouse 
gas emissions.- 2021.- 8 p. 
2. Pascal Barthe, Michel Chaugny, Serge Roudier, Luis Delgado Sanco. Best Available 
Techniques (BAT). Reference Document for the Refining of Mineral Oil and Gas // Industrial 
Emissions Directive 2010/75/EU. Integrated Pollution Prevention and control, 2015. – 719 p. 
3. Decarbonation in the oil and gas industry: international experience and Russian priorities. – 
Energy Center of the Moscow School of Management SKOLKOVO.- March 2021.- 158 с. 
4. United Nations Economic Commission for Europe // Carbon Capture, Use And Storage 
(CCUS), 2021 – 36 c.

Creeping flow between two parallel planes (Hele-Shaw cell) 
Troshkin Alexander Romanovich 
Student 
Gubkin Russian State University of Oil and Gas 
(National Research University) 
Scientific supervisor: Doctor of Science, Assoc. Prof. Khanukaeva D. Yu. 
Academic adviser: Senior Lecturer Vinogradova L.A. 
 
ABSTRACT 
The paper is devoted to Newtonian fluid flow simulation in nanocapillaries (Hele-Shaw 
cell). Different boundary conditions on capillary walls were considered to determine the 
dependences of velocity profiles on each of them. It was also described how the velocity profile 
behaves with changing the characteristic flow parameters. The reasons were established explaining 
the flow rate increase in nanocapillaries with roughened walls. The problem concerned is of 
considerable practical importance for the fluid flow simulation in thin channels, e.g. capillaries and 
cracks, exhaustively accounts for a great variety of technical processes. 
 
KEYWORDS 
Poiseuille flow, nanocapillary, Stokes approximation, Hele-Shaw cell, Newtonian fluid, 
boundary conditions, velocity profile, flow rate. 
 
Consider the case of two-dimensional flow between two parallel planes. Within this frames 
some simplifications are realized which can facilitate understanding of complex hydrodynamic 
problems. 
The problem mentioned is increasingly important in the context of rapidly developing 
theory and applications of polymeric material, biophysical problems, those of fluid filtration theory 
and this model is also used in numerous engineering applications. 
A plane 2R-wide nanochannel is represented as a Hele-Shaw cell with stationary plates. 
Fluid motion along them occurs due to the pressure drop, other external forces being absent. The 
process is assumed to be isothermal and stationary, with all fluid properties including density and 
viscosity being constant. The Stokes approximation is used:

This model is suitable for comparison with experimental data and concluding on whether such a
